NATO 556

Someone I talk to on a semi-regular basis made this for $10, from a piece of pine, plywood, PVC pipe, a dowel rod, three feet of electrical wiring, and spray paint.
 
 It's a rather faithful and accurate reproduction of my former country's most prolific submachine gun, the Sten MKII. I fail to see any way police could tell that it's fake if it were used in the commission of a robbery. They can be readily made, in supposedly large numbers, with two days of work, from the most unsuspecting of supplies.
 
 And how will Australia address this fact?
